name: Romantic Oceanfront Resort - Stunning View!
description:
This boutique resort is a tropical paradise with a small seasonal beach and a lap-length pool. The unit is a private aerie with a fantastic view. The kitchen and bathroom were recently remodeled.

The space
CONDO 322
Entering 322 for the first time is a very special experience. The stunning view of the Pacific reaches across the apartment and stops you in your tracks even before you set foot in the living room. You know instantly that you are about to have a wonderful vacation. The lanai is just 45 yards from the water’s edge and offers stunning views of the ocean and the islands of Lanai and Molokai. You can watch whales in season (December to April) and rainbows and sunsets unparalleled throughout the year.
This is a very private condo. It is a top (3rd) floor end unit. There is no one above you and only one unit next to you separated by a thick block wall. There is a complete kitchen with all dish ware and cookware. Parking and wireless Internet are p

host_about: My wife Judy and I just bought this wonderful condo. There is a peaceful bliss about the place. The little pocket cove beach, the abundance of turtles, the tiki torches in the evening, grilling fresh fish from the local market while watching the sun set, sitting on the lanai with a glass of wine while the stars come out, oh my! Judy is an RN, I designed ship interiors in a former life and now write plays with modest success.

neighborhood_overview:
With countless captivating beaches, near-perfect weather year-round, and panoramic views everywhere you look, it’s hard to argue that Hawaii is anything other than a tropical island oasis! The Hawaiian Islands are incredibly unique, unlike anywhere else in the world. That is clearly evident in everything from our breathtaking scenery to our all-encompassing Aloha spirit!

Maui has been voted the "Best Island in the World" for over 23 years. With daytime temperatures ranging from roughly 85 degrees F during the winter, it's easy to see why Maui is such a popular destination choice and the #1 island in the world.

Here’s why I think the South side of the island (where Kihei is located) is the best place to stay. South Maui really has it all! ;)

The sunny South shores of Kihei offer 6 miles of popular, sun kissed beaches with warm, balmy days and cool, tropical nights.

Typically, humidity levels in Kihei are VERY LOW and the annual rainfall
host_about:
Aloha from Maui!

Congratulations on your decision to book a vacation in sunny Maui, Hawaii; the #1 island in the world for over 25 years.  :)

I would be honored to help you choose accommodations in Maui that fit your needs, desires, and budget. 

As a full-time resident on Maui for over 15 years, I am very familiar with all that this wonderful Island has to offer.  I absolutely love my job as both an owner and property manager of vacation rentals on Maui.  The fact that I get to help others plan their Hawaiian vacation and/or relocation to the magical island of Maui is literally the icing on top of the cupcake!

If you are wanting to purchase property on Maui, I am a licensed realtor in the State of Hawai'i, own a property management company in Maui, and am also a certified Home Staging Expert.  I would love to speak with you and answer any questions you might have about vacation rentals on Maui.

In addition to managing lots of amazing properties directly across the street from the awesome, sun kissed beaches of south Maui, I am also the proud owner of my own vacation rentals.   The condos I own are called Tracy’s Tropical Treasures.  They are listed on Airbnb as Tracy's Tropical Treasure #1 (Ocean View), Tracy's Tropical Treasure #2 (Corner Penthouse), Tracy's Tropical Treasure #3 (Ocean View), and my newest addition, Paradise Awaits You! Tracy's Tropical Treasure #4 (Ocean View, Central A.C., and double pane windows, so no road noise inside the condo).  *Tracy’s Tropical Treasure #3 and Paradise Awaits You! Tracy's Tropical Treasure #4 both house up to 4 guests.  :)

Tracy’s Tropical Treasures were Named the #1 Vacation Rentals in all of Maui in 2016.

In November, 2019, I was RANKED #1 again.  ;)

In July of 2022, I was ranked #1 in Kihei for the fourth time.

I have worked very hard for these achievements and on every single occasion, it was one of the best days of my life when I received confirmation that I had won the award.  

I look forward to speaking with you, helping you with your Maui vacation/relocation, and sharing my ALOHA spirit.  I have been in the hospitality industry for over 25 years, and it's really how I choose to live my life.  Pampering guests is my #1 priority!  

* With well over 1000 bookings on the 4 rentals I personally own, I am extremely proud and take great pride in the fact that I have so many wonderful reviews.  Please feel free to check out all the reviews on Airbnb for the proof.   Customer Service is very important to me!

I am also very proud that I have been with Airbnb since 2009 and have also been a "SUPERHOST” since the program was created.  In July of 2022, I earned Superhost status for the 33rd consecutive time.  

Airbnb is, without a doubt, the BEST vacation rental platform of all!  

When Airbnb was first created, I was one of only eight listings in all of Maui.  My claim to fame is that Brian Chesky, himself, actually called me.  Brian is one of the three Airbnb founders.  Back then, I had also listed my car on Airbnb, and Brian said I was the first person to ever list a car on his platform.  He thought it was interesting, and we had a very nice telephone conversation.

By the end of 2020, Maui had over 18,000 vacation rental listings.  The Airbnb platform has grown exponentially.  I am truly honored to be a part of it all; both as an owner and as a property manager and will continue to tell everyone how wonderful Airbnb is for hosts and travelers alike.

Everybody, no matter where they are, can live ALOHA.  Maui is a great way to unlock the positive spirit within all of us.....

Make it a great day!
Tracy O'Reilly R(S)
~ Owner of Tracy’s Tropical Treasures #1 through #4 (these are my personal vacation rentals which were Named the #1 Vacation Rentals in all of Maui for both 2016 and 2019, and then named #1 in Kihei in July of 2022 for the fourth time)
~ Hawai’i Realtor 
(Licensed on all Islands)
License #73694
~ Property Manager/Island Contact for other vacation rentals in South Maui

host_about:
a decade ago,  my husband bailed on the mainland and all its stress to buy a 70 acre farm on the Big Island near Pahoa. We are a working farm located on the east side of the island of Hawaii, about 30 min south of Hilo on the Puna Coast, close to the quaint village of Pahoa.
We spend our days tending to gardens, the fruit orchards, maybe a day at the local black sand beach called Kehena, playing volleyball or just watching sunsets.
Our guests tend to be outdoor types who love to be in nature.  We invite you up for coffee if you'd like or you can hang by yourself and we'll ignore you if that's what you want.  Then you'll be in your own little paradise and only contacting us when you need info or want to chat.
A couple of mottos to live by include:
'Ua mau ke ea o ka'aina i ka pono o Hawaii'  -- The life of the land in Hawaii is preserved in righteousness.
'Aloha mai no, aloha aku; o ka huhu ka mea e ola ' ole ai' ---When love is given, love should be returned; anger is the thing that gives no life.

host_about:
I'm a Cal Poly, SLO Graduate with a BS degree in Business Administration.  I worked as a WIne Specialist for Gallo Wine  Company and Young's Market Company before getting married and having two kids.  I took some time off to raise my family, and now that my kids are in middle school, I work full time managing the eight homes we own on Maui.  

My husband Troy and I started out with two vacation rentals in MIssion Beach, San Diego, California in 1994.  We have been in this business for a long time now and know what it takes to make guests happy and run a smooth operation.   

My goal is to have you open the door, and go Wow, this place is amazing!  I pay special attention to every detail:  Interior design, furnishing, amenities, cleanliness, landscaping, kitchen supplies and customer service.  

I love staying in vacation rentals when we travel with the family on ski trips or abroad, but when I'm with my hubby on short business trips we stay at W Hotels.  The W is my inspiration.

name: Enchanting Beach Bungalow with Private Garden
description:
Aloha! We renovated this old-style Hawaiian home so that it will have the charm of old Hawaii with modern conveniences.

Great retreat for a maximum of 2 easy-going, nonsmoking adults (25 years and older only).

The space
This garden oasis (we've planted over 3,000 trees and plants) is in the most awesome location - 100 steps from Kailua Beach where you will find 2.5-miles of its famous soft white-sand and turquoise water - - often rated in the top 10 most beautiful beaches in the world. Beach walk, swim, kayak, wind-surf, kite board, body surf, snorkel, hike, walk/jog the Lanikai loop - there is an abundance of fun activities here or, completely relax and chill out which is very easy in this quiet & secluded bungalow on the 1st level of a 2-story home.

The Enchanting Bungalow is decorated with upscale furnishings, original art and collectables from around the world. You will have your own private entrance, private yard & garden - filled with
neighborhood_overview:
Coastal Living 2018 article:

"There are beach towns, and then there’s a town so stop-in-your-flip-flops gorgeous, it’s tempting to name that place the ultimate beach town. Such is the temptation of Kailua, Oahu’s slender strand along its windward shore that’s home to two idyllic public beaches and 53,000 very lucky Hawaiians.

Surrounded by steep emerald slopes and carved quietly by rivers that flow into Kailua Bay, this understatedly hip community just 12 miles from Honolulu is endowed with extraordinary beauty, a serene lifestyle, small-scale neighborhoods of single-family homes, a walkable downtown with great food and shopping, and vistas without peer"
host_about:
I am a leadership/mgmt consultant and I have been very lucky in that my work has allowed me to coach and lead workshops on 5 continents. My husband and I love to explore the world and, when we are at home, we love to renovate - bringing old homes back to life! 

We have enjoyed welcoming guests into our bungalows here in Kailua - the property is very large (over 20,000 sq. ft.) and so, guests can feel very secluded - everyone has their own private parking space, entry and their own private gardens. If our papaya and bananas trees are fruiting - we share!


 (Website hidden by Airbnb) "One day your life is going to flash before your eyes.
 (Website hidden by Airbnb) Make sure it's worth watching."

The space
Permitted B&B, #BBPH(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Hawaii TATax #206410342401, offers one large private bedroom inside the house that can sleep 2-3, 1 guest bathroom (owner has her own bathroom), outside hot/cold shower, kitchen. Owner has a bedroom inside the B&B. Includes WiFi, Apple TV, laundry and parking.

An Additional local tax of 17.42% will be paid separately to your host upon arrival. A Hawaii General Excise Tax of 4.167% and a Hawaii Transcient Accommodations Tax of 13.25% are required for all permitted B&B's and their guests. Please pay with cash for the taxes.
Airbnb does not collect these taxes at the time of booking, it is a separate charge. Mahalo for your cooperation.

Come enjoy local Haiku. We are
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is central Haiku Town.  A historic plantation town.  My home is an authenic plantation house, built in 1919 and was occupied by the plantation manager and family.  His office was also run out of the house.  It has since been fully restored.  The center of town is a 3-4 minute walk where you can choose from many eateries and a local market is available to you.
host_about: Aloha, I am a Naturopathic Doctor who loves all things natural.  I am an avid gardener and have created a beautiful home and Guest House with edible landscaping and a peaceful enviornment.  I enjoy sharing my home with travelers and listening to their adventures here on Maui.  You can find me doing art projects in the evenings and inviting you in to join me.  I love to cook with the local fruits and vegetables of the island and am always inviting you into my kitchen to learn what is new and delicious....  I am a mother/grandmother with two grown sons and two grandchildren on the mainland.  Please go to Haiku Maui Guest House on You tube for a walk through video of the house.  Mahalo and see you soon.

description:
This is a hotel unit in a boutique hotel located in the heart of Waikiki, and it's 5 to 7 minutes walk to the world famous Waikiki Beach. The property is close to everything in Waikiki

The space
Aloha and welcome to the beautiful island of Oahu.

This is a private unit located in the heart of Waikiki in a boutique Hotel - Aqua Aloha Surf Hotel. The hotel is a Boutique-style, modern hotel. There are 3 different sizes of room in this Hotel and ours has the biggest in size. Most does not come with a balcony but ours does!! So even if you see a cheaper condo in this hotel by a private owner, it is because their studio is a bit smaller.

We own one of the unit and renting it out privately, so this unit does not manage by the Hotel, that's why we can offer the lowest price! It has a Queen-sized bed, TV, A/C, kitchenette, sofa, clean towels, and linens.

We can also provide a hiking tour for a small fee and you can always email us for m
neighborhood_overview: Location, Location, Location! We are in the heart of Waikiki. There are so much to do and see in Waikiki. The world’s most famous beach is just two short blocks away (5 minutes walk).
host_about: Aloha and Welcome to the beautiful island of Oahu. We are Chin & Twu, we are co-owners of several condo in Waikiki. We are both professional, friendly and always enjoy helping the tourist what they want to see and do. We have been living here for 15 years now and knows a lot about this island if you have any questions. Mahalo.

name: Big 1 bdrm apt. in gorgeous setting, yet so close!
description:
Big garden-level space in our home, accessed from the yard, with a bedroom w/ 2 big beds, nicely furnished, looks out at a lush yard on a small river gorge. Stairs from the yard lead down to a short trek to the stream where you may swim, with 3 waterfalls!

NOTE:
Hawaii GE-067-950-7968-02 &
TA-067-950-7968-01
This is a hosted rental so per Hawaii County Planning Dept is therefore exempt from Hawaii County Bill 108 so we are able now to consider less than 30 day rentals as well as longer ones.

The space
Nicely furnished large (nearly 800 SF) one bedroom unit with both king and queen beds, so can very comfortably sleep up to 4, on a beautiful river gorge with nearby waterfall and swimming pond. You'll have a full bathroom with tub/shower, kitchenette (no full-size range), private patio, shared sauna, cable TV, DVR and Wi-Fi. Lush quiet surroundings, yet only 5 minutes to downtown Hilo. Windows look out at beautiful large, landscaped yard
neighborhood_overview: Very quiet, peaceful neighborhood of full-time, well-established homes, mostly long-time residents are ethnic Japanese families. Only a mile or so to Scenic Drive where the island's best botanical gardens are located. Walk or bike to "Pinkie's Beach" or even to famous Honoli'i surf beach.  Easy access to downtown Hilo only 5 minute, beautiful drive down the coastal highway.
host_about: We're two dads, originally from Utah & Virginia (with two beautiful daughters, ages 10 and 14) who enjoy traveling and meeting others and now also sharing our homes in San Francisco & Hawaii with others. It's wonderful to associate with a diverse group of people from many places and cultures.  So far we've lived in Germany together and in Thailand, Korea, Sweden and Nigeria separately.   We are happy to hear and share your experiences or just leave you alone in peace and quiet, as you prefer!   Our homes are comfortable, welcoming and we'd be happy to host you!

name: OCEAN FRONT 2b/2ba Amazing Views! Princeville pool
description:
E Komo Mai. Welcome to our Kauai ZenDen. Breathtaking views from every room. Our two bedroom two bath well equipped condo sits on the bluff of Kauai's beautiful north shore. One of the only 2 bedroom condos on the north shore that have ocean front views from both bedrooms as well as living area.
Ground floor unit with large bluff green belt directly outside the lanai doors.
Completely remodeled from floor to ceiling. Ground level entry, no stairs.
Pool and bbq on site.

The space
We welcome you to stay at "Kauai Zen Den", our home on the cliff over the sea.
The crystal clear waters below are teaming with sea life offering excellent snorkeling for our adventurous guests. It is common to spot sea turtles just by gazing at the beautiful coral reefs from atop the bluff. During whale season you can have a front seat to the Humpback's spectacular show. A short hike below takes you to a magical cove with a double ended sea cave which serves as a rest
host_about:
Steve and Ahlea have raised their 3 now adult children on the beautiful Island of Kauaʻi. 
Along with our pets; Marley, Rita, Mochi and Tiki, we have a beautiful home in Wailua on the east side of Kauaʻi. 
Kauaʻi has been very good to our Ohana and we believe it is our kuleana to give back the same.

name: Maluhia Guest House Welcomes Large Groups
description:
Enjoy a spacious island home for your mountain adventure on Hawaii Island with your friends and family near the Hawaii Volcanoes National Park. See the gamut of Hawaiian life in the rainforest and quaint village of Volcano. This guest house was established in 2010. It is a licensed Short-Term Vacation Rental unit(STVR-19-365982) and has a Nonconforming Use Certificate (NUC-19-1863) as required by the State Of Hawaii.

The space
The Maluhia Guest House vacation rental is a huge house with five bedrooms, three bathrooms, and enough beds to sleep 12 people. Specializing in hosting large groups, this rental is made to let our guests enjoy the whole house, its complete kitchen and spacious landscaped yard. It is located in a native 'ohia forest in a quiet neighborhood in Volcano on the island of Hawaii.

Located on the slopes of Kilauea, it is within a five minutes drive to the Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, the Volcano Art Center Gallery, the Ki
neighborhood_overview: The Maluhia Guest House is located in the Mauna Loa Estates subdivision.  It is a quiet neighborhood in a rainforest setting.  The wide paved roads make travel or walking expeditions enjoyable.
host_about:
Mililani and Don Hughes are the hosts of the Maluhia Guest House.  Both are retired teachers and school administrators.  After retirement, Don was a rancher in Volcano with a small operation offering grass fed beef.  They have lived in Volcano since 1981 and are well known in the community for their volunteer work.

They love to share the island with visitors.  Mililani is a poet and writer who is very interested in Hawaiian culture.  She is a hula student.  Don is a science teacher who is interested in physiology and anatomy.  His current interest besides cattle ranching is enlarging his biodiesel production.

Both have traveled to continental USA, Japan, Great Britain, Italy, and France.  They like to travel and learn more about the lifestyles of the everyday people.   As hosts, they would like to show guests what the aloha spirit is like outside of the Waikiki stereotype.

name: Romantic Maui: Your home 25 feet from Ocean!
description:
The condo is appointed like a 5 star hotel without the price tag! It's a beautiful space, 25ft from the ocean with a remodeled kitchen, bathroom, & A/C. Lahaina is a 10min drive and it's a short walk to sandy beaches & restaurants! A vacation condo should feel like home. I've filled it with things I love... art, a guitar, a jellyfish lamp and more... so hopefully you'll love it too!

The space
The beautiful pacific ocean is 25 ft away from your lanai! Listen to the waves and see the stunning views of Lanai and Molokai. During whale season, you can see whales all day long. The condo itself is designed as something I would expect from an upscale Maui resort. So it's very well appointed and very comfortable. This includes a new high end Sterns & Foster King Mattress. A vacation condo should feel like home and somewhere you look forward to returning to.

Prices you see on Airbnb include everything... tax, parking, etc. No surprises.

COVID:
Fo
neighborhood_overview:
There's a sandy beach a 1/4 miles to the South that's an easy walk. It's a great, safe beach with ok snorkeling. Better snorkeling can be found at Ka'anapali beach (5 min.) or Honolua Bay (15 min). A less crowded beach is about 1 mile away.

Restaurants and limited shopping are within a couple blocks. For more extensive shopping, you'll need to drive 5 min to Ka'anapali/Whaler's Village or drive 10 min to Lahaina.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Jim Tierney. I live most of the year in San Francisco and escape to Maui whenever I get tired of the foggy weather. I run a small software company and have the good fortune of being able to work anywhere there's an internet connection. Luckily that's the case with Maui, so whenever I get an urge for whale watching, diving, or laying in the sun it's no problem coming over. I love diving and the diving in Maui is spectacular, there are some really beautiful spots. I also have a passion for photography, particularly whales and outdoor scenes, so you'll see some of my work on the walls of the unit.

I hope you'll check out my place. I put a lot of work into it making sure it was a livable space for when I'm there. So I think the standards I have for the condo is much higher than most rental units.

I bought this because I'll be there about two months of the year and I wanted something on the ocean. A friend of mine lives in the same building so I was very familiar with the property and all it offered (ok, so mostly it offered the ocean about 20 feet way :-). It's amazing to watch the sun set during the summer, see the whales during the winter, and listen to the waves all year long.

name: Beach Condo on Molokai
description:
The space
Unit is located within an attractive condominium complex on the island’s northwest shore called Paniolo Hale, which translates “Cowboy House” in Hawaiian. The units all have wrap-around, screened-in porches or lanais. When the French doors on the living room are open, the living space expands to include this semi-enclosed area effectively blurring the boundaries between interior and exterior space. It’s a great place to eat meals, read, overlook the ocean, or even sleep as a cool breeze blows and waves break gently in the distance.

Unit is a 5-minute walk to Kepuhi Beach (which it overlooks) and a 10-minute walk to Makehorse Beach.

Although the condominium complex dates back to 1980, the bathroom and kitchen have recently been renovated. Unit amenities include:

Washer & dryer,

Stainless steel electric stove with range,

Stainless steel refrigerator with filtered water and icemaker,

Microw
neighborhood_overview: Our condo unit is located in a condominium complex that is fairly secluded and quiet (save for wind in the trees, crashing ocean waves in the distance, and the songs of tropical birds.  While the rest of the West End of Molokai is relatively dry in comparison, our condo complex has a lush Monkey Pod tree canopy shading the entire complex.  Its very beautiful.
host_about:
I'm an avid surfer and San Francisco native from a family of artistic beach people.  As principal at MH Architects, I enjoy a hands-on level of involvement with every project throughout the design and construction process.  

When I'm not designing cool houses, wineries, bowling alleys, and offices, I love to go to Hawaii with my family.

We invite you to come and enjoy this lovely three bedroom two bath home situated on 21 acres of lush island beauty. This property is unique in many ways but one of the most amazing parts of this property is the private botanical gardens that surround the home.

The space
This property is a hidden gem, beautifully landscaped with an amazing collection of palms, bamboo and orchids. The property is located on the rugged and picturesque Puna Coast of the Big Island. Situated on 21 acres ideal for a quiet vacation. The main residence commands sweeping views to the east where the sun rises from the Pacific Ocean to bathe the expansive garden and huge stone terrace in early morning light. neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a unique collection of eclectic artists.

Picture yourself in paradise. Our beautiful, clean, beach style rental is situated under a plumeria tree and is available for your relaxing stay in Kailua. This private 2 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment sleeps 4 adults or a 5 person family and is within 200 meters to Kailua Beach Park. Our two bedroom unit has a washer and dryer, private entrance and its own access to the beach road which is a 2 minute walk to Kailua Beach. There are kayak and surfboard rentals, food, groceries, and shops all within a 3 minute walk from the house. Our apartment is part of a newly built house and is extremely clean, with a well stocked kitchen and bea

name: Coco Unit D Is A Charming Sun-Filled Studio with River Views
description:
Fern Grotto Inn is the perfect home base for exploring Kauai. It is centrally located in Kapaa, on the banks of the Wailua River & only a block from the beach. You can paddle the Wailua River with our complimentary kayaks and SUP's or take our bikes for a spin on the bike path.

Spend quiet mornings at a countertop bar with coffee & river views & whip up breakfast in a kitchenette with a fridge and induction cooktop. Even a suite of small appliances is at the ready, including a blender, coffeemaker, toaster & microwave.

View all our listings here:
Airbnb.com/p/ferngrottoinn

410040230000, TA-193-000-2432-01

name: WAIKIKI - Direct Diamond Head View
description:
NOTE: This property requires a minimum 30-night length of stay. Guests must meet Covid-19 quarantine exemption status.

Located on the preferred Diamond Head side of Waikiki, this 2-bedroom 1-bath 1-parking condo features a spectacular unobstructed DIRECT DIAMOND HEAD VIEW and is perfect for your Hawaiian adventures. It's an easy 5-minute walk to the best part of Waikiki Beach. Numerous dining options from casual to upscale are in the immediate area. Convenient, clean, cool, casual luxury !!

The space
The best Diamond Head view in all of Waikiki is yours to behold from this immaculate, fully furnished and well-appointed condominium. This is for you, the guest who appreciates quality and value.

A spectacular view of Diamond Head, Hawaii's most famous landmark, fills the entire living area. The outside Lanai has seating for two...enjoy your favorite morning brew and watch a beautiful Hawaiian sunrise dance on the slopes of Diamond Head.
neighborhood_overview: This property is located in the preferred Diamond Head side of Waikiki, just minutes from the best attractions and shopping the city has to offer. You are close to the buzz of Waikiki but the the property is located next to a residential area, so it is relaxing and quiet. Waikiki Beach is a pleasant 5-minute walk, just 2 blocks from the condo.  The Honolulu Zoo, Kapiolani Park, Waikiki Aquarium and more are all within walking distance.  If you don't feel like cooking, there are many casual and fine-dining restaurants in the immediate area.
host_about:
Aloha :)  I'm a long-time resident of the beautiful island of Oahu.  I love sharing the magic of Hawaii with all my friends and guests.

As you can see, I love the ocean and water sports in particular.  This was a surf session at a secret spot on Oahu (yes, they still exist).  The rainbow, well, that's why Hawaii is magical.

If you have any questions at all about the property or Hawaii in general, feel free to contact me at any time.  It would be my pleasure to assist you with your vacation. Thank you for your interest and I look forward to meeting you.

name: Kealakekua Bay Cottage With A View!
description:
This beautiful property overlooks 60 sweeping miles of the South Kona coast line including stunning views of Kealakekua Bay and the Captain Cook Monument. Cottage is the best of Old Hawai'i with all the modern amenities.
If this cottage is booked, please check out our other cottage at:
www.airbnb.co./rooms/84617

The space
This private, secluded and charming Old Hawaii style Ohana (family dwelling) is 5 minutes from beautiful Kealakekua Bay, Manini Beach, and Ke'ei Beach. The bay is famous for its incredible snorkeling, standup paddling, kayaking and opportunities to swim with the local pod of spinner dolphins.

The cottage has a Cal-King bed, a well appointed kitchenette, gas barbecue, covered lanai and sweeping views of the south Kona coastline. The full bathroom offers a shower overlooking Kealakekua Bay and the Captain Cook monument. Along with charming Old Hawai'i ambiance, enjoy the modest conveniences of Wi-Fi, Netflix and flat s
host_about: Peter and Barbara have mixed histories on the Big Island.  Peter, a 20 year resident and recently retired, is enjoying all the water sports available within a few minutes of his home, especially snorkeling and stand up paddling.  Barbara is newer to Hawaii and commutes from the main land to join Peter with his adventures as often as possible.  Both are passionate about the South Kona area and give back to the community that has given them so much by volunteering for Habitat for Humanity and Friends of Manini Beach.  Peter is an avid gardener and when not on the water can be found planting, transplanting and trimming in his exotic Hawaiian garden.  Barbara, when not following Peter on some bay or reef excursion, is busy identifying and learning the habits of the local birds that share the accommodations on their beautiful parcel of land.  Both find time daily to sit quietly and watch incredible sunsets on Kealekakua Bay from the lanai of their recently renovated historic Hawaiian home.

name: Peaceful Private Rainforest Getaway
description:
This little cabin is so cozy, it's like your home away from home. You will find most everything you will need while staying here. It's tucked away in the trees with a National Park right in the back yard! You'll wish you could stay longer!

The space
Come experience this cute comfortable cabin nestled in the woods, surrounded by tall Ohia trees and lots of tropical birds to serenade you. Situated at 2000' elevation (which means it might get a bit chilly at times), on a very private, peaceful, gated 20 acre piece of land on the Southern most part of the Big Island. Located half way between Kona and Hilo with grocery stores and restaurants nearby, 60 miles from the Hawaii Volcano National Park entrance, 15 miles from the famous Green Sands Beach and Punalu'u the black sand beach where you'll find Hawaiian Hawksbill turtles sunning on the sand.
Just 5 minutes away from the cabin, the Kahuku Unit of the Volcano National Park is now open to the public. There are
neighborhood_overview: The Volcano National Park Kahuku Unit is right next door and you can drive in and hike around. If you're into nature and easy hiking, it's a must do. Open Thursday - Sunday 8-4.
host_about: I've lived in Hawaii since 1976 and have loved every minute of it. Plants are my passion and this place shows it. I would love to share this magical piece of paradise with you.

name: 5 min Walk to famous Kailua Beach
description:
Our unit is bright and airy. Close proximity to the beach.
We have done extensive remodeling completed in November 2020.
Reviews featured before November 2020 were based on prior descriptions and offerings.

The space
The space is 720sf (66.5 sqm) studio apartment. Tastefully decorated with fully equipped kitchen.
King size bed in the bedroom and a very comfortable American Leather Comfort queen sleeper sofa bed in the living room.
Unit can comfortably accommodate 4 adults. Bright modern bathroom with deep soaking tub.

There are sliding louver doors separating bedroom and living room to ensure some privacy when there are more than a couple staying.

Beach accessories such as towels, chairs & umbrella, boogie boards are yours to use.

You'll have off street private parking by the entrance to the unit.

Guest access
There's a grill for barbequing downstairs.

Other things to
neighborhood_overview: Kailua is a beautiful beach town.  The beach is a 5 minute walk across the street from our place.  Lots of great restaurants in downtown Kailua about 2 miles south.  Grocery shopping at Wholefoods, Safeway, Target, Foodland and Times are all within walking distance from each other.

host_about:
Aloha!
I have been on the north shore for about 13 years and moved from just outside Detroit, Michigan back in 1992. I live with my 7 year old son and  wife from Venezuela who was originally born in the USA. I own and operate a Window Covering Business (shades, blinds, drapery) which we manufacture here locally. 
I body board when I have time and enjoy traveling the islands and having time to spend with my family.
Some of my favorite things to do is body boarding, golfing with my son, eating shave Ice on hot day, and going to the farmers markets on Saturday at Sunset beach elementary school then in Haleiwa on Sunday.

Well-equipped loft condo in Maui Vista Resort perfect for a family stay. Amazing panoramic views of the ocean. Across the street from Kamaole Beach I, just a 5-minute walk away. Central location in Kihei - restaurants, night life within walking distance. Snorkeling, surfing nearby.

The space
Well-equipped loft condo in Maui Vista Resort perfect for a family stay. Amazing panoramic views of the ocean. Across the street from Kamaole Beach I, just a 5-minute walk away. Central location in Kihei - restaurants, convenience shopping, and night life within walking distance. Snorkeling, surfing and whale watching nearby.

PRICE INCLUDES: 14.41% Tax, Cleaning & Parking (1 vehicle)

2.5-BEDROOMS / 2 FULL BATHS - SLEEPS 6
The master bedroom is on the 1st floor with a queen-size bed and closet. The vaulted ceiling opens up into a spacious loft with 2 twin beds and separate bath. There is also a small attic bedroom with a queen bed in the rear loft ex
neighborhood_overview: Kihei is right on the beach and down-to-earth. Tourists and locals pass on the street all the time and everyone tends to be super-friendly. Bicycles or mopeds can be rented within a mile of the condo and are fantastic for exploring (or for giving your teenagers a bit of independence during your stay!). Surfing lessons and board rentals, as well as kiteboarding, are right down the street. No need to eat out every day with our well-appointed kitchen and on-site gas BBQ grills available. Baby equipment can be rented nearby - google "baby equipment rental kihei" for several options. Pack a picnic, grab some beach towels from the closet, and head down to the beach for a picnic and maybe catch the sunset!
host_about:
Hello! I love Maui and especially Kihei. I'm down-to-earth and prefer condo travel because of the flexibility it offers and the opportunity to "live like a local!" My parents and I host guests in four condo units in Kihei in a complex right across from the beach. When I'm on Maui, I love to walk on the beach, read a book by the pool, shop the local produce markets, and watch the AMAZING sunsets over Charlie Young Beach.

When I'm not on Maui, I decorate cakes for a living - I specialize in crazy, over-the-top, gravity-defying, "Cake Boss" type creations. I'm passionate about creating memories, both with my cakes and with our fantastic Kihei condos. Come stay with us!

name: A slice of Aloha in Historic Downtown Kona Hawaii
description:
Approved for COVID short term & 14 day quarantine rentals. 400 sq ft condo in the heart of downtown Kona. Hawaiian decor & an eating lanai overlooks the pool. 1 queen bed, sleeps 2. Small complex on Alii Drive has pool, hot tub, cable & wifi in unit. A full sized refrigerator & kitchenette w/ microwave, coffee & basic utensils. Location a "10" just steps to ocean, eats, pubs, stores. FREE parking.

The space
Aloha! We are an approved Short Term Rental. We are 98 miles from the Volcano on the opposite side of the island with blue skies, ocean breezes, and beaches to explore.
If you are looking for a clean contemporary 400 sq ft studio condo in the heart of downtown Kona where a single person can be alone but feel welcome or a couple may want to enjoy each other's company then this AirBnB Slice of Aloha is for you! Our location is a "10" and our price per night is lower than many of the local condos and hotels including the Marriott Courtyard, Sh
neighborhood_overview:
Walking to everything in downtown Kona including coffee, markets, pubs, restaurants, shopping, day spas etc.
The Islander has it's own small beach across the street but it is not a great swim beach at all, but you can view sunset and turtles with a keen eye.
Best swim beach in walking distance (5 minutes) is at Kona Pier in front of the King Kam (Courtyard) hotel. Paddle board and water sports equipment rentals available there. I go there daily when on island for a refreshing dip. You can also swim the Ironman course from the Kona Pier and many like minded swimmers going out between 6AM and 8 AM.
The neighborhood is VERY safe for Hawaii and everybody walks around and feels the aloha spirit in downtown Kona.
host_about: We are exotic fruit farmers, our main crop is Dragonfruit.   We love to travel and do so extensively.  If I am not on the farm or in Hawaii you can probably find me on the bike or in our Airstream camper with our cool Persian cat 8Ball.    Our goal as hosts is to give to give guests a clean and appropriately furnished temporary home without being an over bearing host.  We love hosting people who understand that AirBnB is not a corporate hotel situation- but rather there are faces behind the hosting team who genuinely care about the experiences we give our guests.    If you are our guest and need something, call, we will help you any way we can.  Even though we may not get to meet you, we do care and want you to have a great experience.   Come stay with us, we welcome you with open arms!  Aloha!

name: Aloha Falls Sanctuary. Peaceful Waterfall Paradise
description:
Aloha Falls creates the space for your experience of heaven on Earth. You will find yourself nestled in the jungle with views of a fern-gully like waterfall paradise, engulfed by bamboo and fragrant flowering trees with orchids nestled in their branches. Enjoy the space for a private retreat or invite your family and friends to fill the house. The entire home and property is filled with healing intentions that evoke peace and happiness. Here is your Hawaii home for respite with all the feels.

The space
The big island is one of the safest places in the world. Come stay for a month or more with a 40% off discount!

Aloha Falls is our attempt to show you and the world what the aloha spirit is all about. Aloha spirit is the embodiment of the love that joins all life on Earth! When you stay at Aloha Falls you will feel your body relax and your mind calm down as you enjoy the view and the sounds of the beautiful waterfall and the luscious tropical rain fores
neighborhood_overview:
Aloha Falls is in the famous neighborhood called Reed's Island. It is a small little street where you are surrounded on both sides by rivers and waterfalls. Come dark, the sounds of the coqui frogs will demand that you tune into nature and just "be".
As mentioned earlier, you can walk right into downtown Hilo. You can also walk up to Rainbow Falls, a famous world attraction.
You are a 30 min drive to Volcano National Park. 10 mins to the local beaches and Hilo airport.
Don't miss out on the boutiques of downtown Hilo that feature local artists and craftsmen. There are also awesome places to eat right downtown.
host_about:
Dedicated steward of the land and her people! Sierra's days are spent cultivating the garden(s), cleaning the gorgeous space and sharing her therapeutic, healing touch!
For Sierra, life doesn't get any better than it is on the Big Island... hiking, adventuring, swimming in the ocean are a year round reality here in Hawai'i. Sierra's mottos are, "cultivate peace" and "aloha 'aina!"

name: Peaceful & Sweet Studio Style Condo
description:
The “Hala Hale” is a studio style condo with kitchenette and full bath.

This is a charming, top story, studio style condo with vaulted ceiling, kitchenette (sm. fridge, counter with cooking space, sink & induction cook top), balcony.

Convenient to all beaches and island adventures and still walking distance from Princeville shops. A perfect, peaceful launchpad for your island adventures. We provide local advice & all amenities you need. Come enjoy our condo. We're excited to host you!

The space
Private, 1 Bedroom, North Shore Condo. FULLY EQUIPPED AND CLOSE TO EVERYTHING! This is the best North Shore location possible!

We provide you with everything you need, making it easy to take advantage of all the spectacular wonders of the North Shore, which are all within minutes of this prime location.

This one bedroom, bungalow-style condo is newly remodeled and clean. The condo has nearly every amenity: a good sized kitc
neighborhood_overview:
Princeville is an amazingly convenient and beautiful community on the North Shore. We absolutely love it and here's why:

From our location it is easy to walk to the beach or the grocery store and the views in either direction are spectacular, with ocean one direction and mountains and waterfalls the other! In fact there is a network of fantastic walking and running trails all over Princeville, making it likely the safest and easiest of locations of the island to walk or take a run. Another bonus is that all the nearby golf courses are open for pedestrian exploration after 5pm, which is beyond excellent for sunset strolls.

The coastline below Princeville provides some of the most pristine, clear water due to the lack of rivers and fresh water runoff. Because of these, Princeville has some amazing exploring to enjoy below its bluffs (surf conditions permitting!!). The clear water provides some of the very best turtle viewing, snorkeling, pristine coves and nooks and
host_about:
Aloha! I am Lani and I am passionate about sharing and passing on the love I have for my island Home of Kauai to those who visit this special place.

I’ve lived on Kauai for much of my life. I was born near Tunnels Beach and have always considered the North Shore of Kauai “home”. However, adventures beyond the islands, eventually brought me to the mainland and abroad.  I went to school in Santa Cruz California and even got interested in colder climates for a while. Between travels abroad, I worked as an entrepreneur and in various outdoor industries for the better part of a decade, living in amazingly scenic, rural towns. One of my favorite of those towns was Jackson Hole Wyoming, where I lived for several years before moving back to Kauai. It took searching the world to ultimately realize, there’s no place like home.  

I truly enjoy passing on the love and reverence I have of my island home to my guests. I offer my local knowledge and recommendations in addition to providing exceptional quality accommodation and service. I want to ensure that my guests have as much fun and as little worries as possible on their visits to Kauai!

I love offering conscientious  travelers an amazing home while they explore the Garden Island, and both my condos are thoughtfully equipped, well located and always kept clean and attended to with lots of love.

I am are honored to have received such great reviews, and maintained a consistent Airbnb SuperHost rating that I have held strong for several years.

I am grateful for my guests, as they give to me just as much as I give them.

Happiest of travels and lots of Aloha to you!

Lani

name: North Shore Resort, Private room
description:
Some guests have stayed here and rarely left the property. There Is local entertainment every night at the hotel pool bar. Guests can check at the hotel and take advantage of other activities offered there. The beach here is beautiful and the safest during winter waves. This area is near many points of interest and we are glad to offer ideas and places to explore off the grid.

PLEASE NOTE: there is a 13 percent hotel tax payable in cash to us at arrival.

The space
On the North Shore Oahu, Hawaii. Home of the best beaches, snorkel, surf swim etc. We're on the golf course across from a secluded beach. Turtle Bay resort hotel is steps away from us. We have a two story, two bedroom two bath unit. Close by are heated pools and tennis courts. We have 24 hour security and guest parking. Hotel ammenities, restaurants and shops are all on site. Beautiful vegetation and almost always balmy, breezy and warm. Internet, cable tv. furnished. We also ha
neighborhood_overview: Our gated community on the resort grounds are abundant with tropical vegetation.  Lots of colorful flowers that attract a multitude of birds, we even have a flock of small parrots that fly by every evening.  This is a great place for long walks on the beach or in the woods next to the beach.  You can rent horses and ride on the beach or take a surf lesson. People are friendly here!
host_about: My husband and I are semi retired but very active.  We golf, ride horse, active in our church, and I'm a writer/ oil painter.  Our children are a big part of our life.  My older son Garrett has the guiness record for the biggest wave riden and all the sons and grandsons are competitive surfers.  I was in Portugal for a month last year while Garrett was looking for the waves there.  I've enjoyed traveling to Bali, Canada, Mexico, France, All of the US, and Japan.  I built a house in Belize in the '70s.  I've been here in Hawaii 30+ years.'

name: Amazing Oceanfront - Kona, Hawaii!
description:
Amazing ocean/ beachfront in Kailua-Kona, Hawaii. Located in the 15+acre Keauhou Kona Surf & Racquet Club we enjoy close proximity to ocean, golf, shopping, etc! It's all here and wonderful. With 3 tennis courts and a fabulous pool - it's perfect!

The space
The nightly rental rate does NOT includes 14.42% taxes for Ironman (October 1-15th and December 15-March 31st timeframe). These taxes will be billed separately through AirBnB resolution center prior to arrival.

Our home has spectacular views indoors and out! Enjoy all the upgrades in this beautiful unit. No expense is spared when it comes to repair or updating..we want the best for our guests!

Lay in your king pillow-top bed and watch the moon over the water or the sun sparkling on the waves as you wake up. Dine while you listen to the sounds of the surf and watch the gorgeous colors of the sunset. Enjoy watching the turtles and yellow tangs in the surf from your master bedroom wall-
neighborhood_overview: This unit is located in a highly desirable 15+ acre oceanfront complex on the Kona coast.  The surrounding units are occupied with both year-round residents and vacation visitors.  There is always a happy atmosphere and people are very welcoming and ready to chat or share information or experiences.  We fell in love with this complex as guests many years ago and enjoy returning year after year.  The pool is arguably the best on the coast and the tennis courts are the same - wonderful!
host_about: I love to travel!  I've been very blessed to enjoy traveling as a child while my dad was in the military and then as an adult for my job and with my husband.  We began visiting Hawaii in 1999 and our annual visits turned into our first purchase of a vacation home in 2006.  It was on our 4th trip to the Big Island of Hawaii and during our 2nd stay at the Keauhou Kona Surf and Racquet Club that we began looking for our own place.  The diversity of this island paradise and the wonderful snorkeling and the lovely townhouse settings made all the other complexes pale in comparison on our searches - we purchased townhouse #59 and returned for our fifth trip to completely redo the unit (tile to ceiling) in preparation for personal and guest visits.  We still feel the same way about this wonderful place and now own a second, completely oceanfront unit (#196) in this same lovely complex.  And, it's only gotten better.  Our goal in rentals is to offer what we'd want and expect in a unit if we were traveling.  Super clean, well maintained, simple and beautful decor, plenty of space to pack away our suitcases and settle in comfortably, good beds & linens, and complete kitchens for at home meals whenever we like.  Fortunately for us, many of our guests appreciate and expect the same type of accomodation and we have several guests or groups of guests that have become repeat visitors to our lovely place/s.  All have said this is the best place they've found and the first place they check for return visits.  We love and appreciate all of our guests but even more so our repeat or referred guests.  We'd be delighted to welcome you and your friends to a stay in paradise. Our motto in life - pay it forward; be the first to do the right thing; set the right example; good karma will follow you.  Our guests should know that we will do everything to help them enjoy their stay with us.  It's a point of pride for us - no cutting corners, etc...we want and expect that guests continue to say how nice they expected it to be and how much nicer it actually was.  And, if there's ever a problem; resolving it is our top priority.  We don't want our guests to worry or be inconvenieced wherever possible.

name: Beautiful Kona  Condo Retreat
description:
This is a very relaxing condo with a wonderful view of the ocean and surrounding jungle from the lanai. The doors have been removed to the lanai so the condo is open to the outside and you feel like you are in a tree house.

Hawaii tax ID#02547973-01

The space
Enjoy a breathtaking ocean view while sipping delightful Kona coffee from the comfort of your private lanai. Our clean, well maintained condo is a fully furnished 2 bedroom-2 bath unit. It includes a full kitchen, living/dining room area and lanai. The kitchen has a pantry, plenty of cabinet space and all major appliances: dishwasher, fridge, stove, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, and blender. There is also plenty of dishware, cookware and silverware to make meal preparation easy when dining in. Both bedrooms have queen sized beds, linens, full closets with hangers, dressers and nightstands. Ceiling fans are included in all rooms to circulate the soothing ocean breezes. The 2nd bathroom also h
neighborhood_overview: The condo is located in a quiet neighborhood.
host_about: I am one member of a family of five who shares in ownership of our Hawaiian condo. We are all from Montana but consider Kona our second home. We love the mountains, outdoors, sunshine, warm weather, fun times and the ocean. Hawaii offers all of those. It gives us pleasure to share our condo with people who want a place to rest, relax and retreat into the spirit and gentle ways of our island. We are family friendly and appreciate others who are thoughtful about sharing our home. As our guest, we try to make your stay informative, enjoyable and relaxing. One of our favorite things to do is to sit on the lanai soaking in the magical views of the ocean. We are sky mile fans and make as many trips over as possible. Probably our motto would be: Treat others as you would like to be treated. Aloha

host_about:
Passionate about happy & healthy for all. An alternative medicine, holistic healing arts proponent I believe all healing comes from the inside out. Ecstatic to have the opportunity to share this magnificent location with guests. 

The macadamia nut orchard boasts 200 actively producing trees for your tasting pleasure along with a variety of other tropical edible fruit. We have figs, bananas, guava, papaya and even pineapples growing here!

name: Tiki Studio With Views of the Ocean
description:
STATE OF HAWAII TA-193-891-1232-01

The space
With tall open beam ceilings, and a beautiful view of the ocean, the Tiki room is a favorite Kona vacation rental. Located in the back of the property farthest from the road, the Tiki room is warm and inviting and you'll love the tropical ocean and mountain breezes that make this room such a delight. Each day the gentle breezes start the day coming in off the ocean and rising up Hualalai mountain (where the legendary Kona coffee is grown), and each evening they gently move back down it's slopes. There are times when you can hear the whales slapping the ocean with their fins as the breeze carries those sounds with it. It also carries the beautiful smells of Hawaiian tropical flowers. There are many things to do in Hawaii, and this Kona rental puts you close enough to walk to beaches, shops, ocean activities, the Kona farmers market, etc. Yet you'll find that your far enough away to still enjoy relaxing after all the fun
neighborhood_overview:
We are within walking distance to Kona town. It is about a 10 minute walk.
It is approximately a 20 minute walk to the pier where there is snorkeling, swimming, tours, kayak and paddle board rentals.
host_about:
Aloha! We are originally from Washington State where we lived in a small town. One day we decided to sell everything and move to Kona and start a vacation rental. Our goal has been to make the place a home away from home for travelers. We want everyone to feel comfortable and enjoy their stay in Kona. We have met so many interesting and wonderful people along the way as well that have made it such a great adventure.

We like to spend time at the beach, snorkel, boogie board, hike and go site seeing to name just a few. One of our favorite times during the year is Iron Man. There are so many things to do in Kona this is definitely the place for us. We hope you come visit us soon.

.

We like to spend time at the beach, snorkel, boogie board, hike and go site seeing to name just a few. One of our favorite times during the year is Iron Man. There are so many things to do in Kona this is definitely the place for us. We hope you come visit us soon.

name: Plumeria Rm with some ocean view.
description:
STATE OF HAWAII TAX # TA-193-891-1232-01

The space
Bright and cheery! The Plumeria room embraces the afternoon sunshine. The room is decorated in the Hawaiian style and includes a small walk in closet. The open window design allows you to enjoy the tropical ocean breeze and partial ocean and coastline views. When you get hungry, the room offers an eating area that looks out over tropical palms or just a short walk takes you to restaurants, coffee shops, and a farmers market. The room is also right across from the Great Wall of Kuakini or in Hawaiian “Ka pa nui o Kuakini.” The wall was created by Royal Kuakini in the 1800's while he was serving as the Royal Governor of the Hawaii Island. Enjoy your stay overlooking a piece of Hawaiian history!
We do not allow Bicycles in the Plumeria room.

Other things to note
This room is located at the middle of the house and closer to the road.
During the day there will be traffic noise. Typica
neighborhood_overview:
We are within walking distance to Kona town. It is about a 10 minute walk to town.
It is approximately a 20 minute walk to the pier where there is snorkeling, swimming, tours, kayak and paddle board rentals.
host_about:
Aloha! We are originally from Washington State where we lived in a small town. One day we decided to sell everything and move to Kona and start a vacation rental. Our goal has been to make the place a home away from home for travelers. We want everyone to feel comfortable and enjoy their stay in Kona. We have met so many interesting and wonderful people along the way as well that have made it such a great adventure.

We like to spend time at the beach, snorkel, boogie board, hike and go site seeing to name just a few. One of our favorite times during the year is Iron Man. There are so many things to do in Kona this is definitely the place for us. We hope you come visit us soon.
